title: James Neal, Connor McDavid help Oilers outlast Kings 6-5
text:
EDMONTON, Alberta (AP) - James Neal scored twice, Connor McDavid had a goal and three assists and the Edmonton Oilers won their second in a row to start the season, beating the Los Angeles Kings 6-5 in an offensive slugfest Saturday night.

Zack Kassian, Joakim Nygard and Darnell Nurse also scored for the Oilers. Dustin Brown, Trevor Lewis, Anze Kopitar, Michael Amadio and Drew Doughty countered for the Kings.

Edmonton tied it 5 minutes into the third when Gaetan Haas banked a pass off the side of the net to Nygard for his first NHL goal.

The Kings surged back in front on a power play when Doughty's point shot ticked off an Oilers' skate and past goalie Mike Smith.

The Oilers tied it up once again on Nurse's goal, and capped the scoring on Neal's power-play goal with 6:32 to go.

UP NEXT

Los Angeles Kings goalie Jonathan Quick (32) looks on as Edmonton Oilers' Zack Kassian (44) and Connor McDavid (97) celebrate a goal during the second period of an NHL hockey game in Edmonton, Canada, Saturday, Oct. 5, 2019. (Jason Franson/The Canadian Press via AP)

Kings: At Calgary on Tuesday night.

Oilers: At New York Rangers on Tuesday night.

Los Angeles Kings ' Blake Lizotte (46) and Edmonton Oilers' Matt Benning (83) battle for the puck during the first period of an NHL hockey game in Edmonton, Canada, Saturday, Oct. 5, 2019. (Jason Franson/The Canadian Press via AP)

Los Angeles Kings' Tobias Bjornfot (33) chases Edmonton Oilers' Connor McDavid (97) during the second period of an NHL hockey game in Edmonton, Canada, Saturday, Oct. 5, 2019. (Jason Franson/The Canadian Press via AP)

Edmonton Oilers celebrate a goal during the first period of an NHL hockey game against Los Angeles Kings, in Edmonton, Canada, Saturday, Oct. 5, 2019. (Jason Franson/The Canadian Press via AP)
